title: Lee Chi Kin
text:
Lee Chi Kin (, born 27 December 1967) is a Hong Kong <a href="association%20football">football</a> <a href="manager%20%28association%20football%29">manager</a> who is currently the Director of football of <a href="Hong%20Kong%20Premier%20League">Hong Kong Premier League</a> club <a href="Eastern%20Sports%20Club">Eastern</a>.
Managerial History.
Yokohama FC Hong Kong and Pegasus.
He won the <a href="Hong%20Kong%20Top%20Footballer%20Awards">Hong Kong Coach of the Year</a> award in 2015 as manager of <a href="Metro%20Gallery%20FC">Yokohama FC Hong Kong</a>.
He moved to <a href="Hong%20Kong%20Pegasus%20FC">Pegasus</a> during the subsequent offseason where he was manager for 20 months before being terminated in April 2016.
Tai Po.
Lee Chi Kin joined <a href="Tai%20Po%20FC">Tai Po</a> in June 2016. He worked quickly to bring on board players whom he had worked with during previous coaching stints including <a href="Yuen%20Chun%20Sing">Yuen Chun Sing</a>, <a href="Wong%20Wai">Wong Wai</a>, <a href="Lee%20Ka%20Yiu">Lee Ka Yiu</a>, <a href="Tan%20Chun%20Lok">Tan Chun Lok</a>, and <a href="Fung%20Hing%20Wa">Fung Hing Wa</a>.
During his first season, he led Tai Po to 6th place in the Premier League, their best finish at that point in club history. The following season, he led the club to a runners-up finishing, better the result from the previous season.
In <a href="2018%E2%80%9319%20Hong%20Kong%20Premier%20League">2018–19</a>, Lee led Tai Po to their first <a href="Hong%20Kong%20Premier%20League">Hong Kong Premier League</a> title in club history, becoming the first district club to win a top flight title since 1963. For this achievement, he was named the 2019 Hong Kong Coach of the Year.
At the end of the season, Lee announced that he would mutually part ways with Tai Po as the club faced budget clubs due to reduced sponsorship.
Eastern.
On 3 July 2019, Lee left Tai Po to join <a href="Eastern%20Sports%20Club">Eastern</a>.
In his first season, the club won the <a href="2019%E2%80%9320%20Hong%20Kong%20Senior%20Challenge%20Shield">2019–20 Senior Shield</a> and the <a href="2019%E2%80%9320%20Hong%20Kong%20FA%20Cup">2019–20 Hong Kong FA Cup</a>.
